data.title: A pleasant surprise.
data.text: My cousin told me about this place so we all went one Sunday early afternoon.  Food is great.  Cuisine is a ,is of sports bar and Latin food.  Their mofongo is great.  Service rather slow.

data.title: fun friday night
data.text: great music  and drinks were good.  Did have to wait for our food, but prices were very reasonable. Nice to have a location like this in South Broward.

data.title: Great ambient but terrible food
data.text: Great place, great ambient, great location, but food compare to some other Dominican Restaurants no good at all. Juana your chef has to go take from me. I have already heard a lot of complaints.

data.title: SUPERIOR Dominican Food!
data.text: I miss my homeland food and this place just did it! Authentic taste and very generous portions. Our hostess, Carolina was just incredible and suggested great items from the menu.

data.title: Nice place, but food not all that
data.text: I went with my husband on a Thursday night & he really wasn't hungry, so he just ordered an appetizer & I ordered a meal.  I liked the atmosphere (music a little load, but good selections), but the food was just ok & the plates are not very big.  Probably would go back just for appetizers & drinks, not really for dinner.

data.title: McDonald's experience is better
data.text:
Place is garbage , staff is garbage, food is garbage, music is to loud... They think they in DR. 
The manager tried to hustle some $ , to accommodate us, but I looked at the place and was like NOT!!! Don't go to this place,they are all stuck up!

data.title: Good latin food with some dancing
data.text: Our family went to Juana's on a Friday night and the festive atmosphere took us by surprise in a good way. They had a DJ playing music and it was pretty busy with a nice ce crowd. Don't expect to go here to have a meaningful conversation because the music gets a bit loud. The food and the service are good, and there's a small area where people can dance.

data.title: Food was ok, nothing too..
data.text: First time at this restaurant. My husband and I decided we wanted to go for Spanish food not to fat from our hotel stay. We arrived at Juana's - music was good but kind of loud for only being a Monday. We ordered chicharron de pollo con hueso, arroz blanco y habichuelas Rojas. The chicken was 6 pieces if so it wasn't bad or dried out but portions are small. If your a eater like us get ready to double up on sides. It's more of a gourmet type of restaurant because of portions per servings. We also ordered Quippes which was very good. The problem in this restaurant is the service . The waitress was like she didn't want to work and she was too busy running her mouth and not attending guests. This restaurant - food is good but remember they serve small portions and a bit overpriced for Spanish food. I will not be going back.

data.title: Great Party Place on Weekends
data.text: This is the place to dance the night away... Good friendly place great food and drinks  bands on weekend

data.title: Great time!!!
data.text: Love going friday/saturady night. Great time, restaurant has person singing spanish music/DJ. You able to dance or just have a great dinner. We order Juanas platter which has, salami, chicken, tostone, cheese.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Ufff!!! I be there Dec 3. Service excellent, great music, the dinner out of planet. Highly Recommend it!

data.title: Too bad...
data.text: Just got back from Juana's, first time visiting.  Will be my last time.  Super loud-ok, but to wait 38 minutes for appetizers on a Sunday? Ordered sliders, they didnt come out how I asked them, wet bottom bun, without cooked onions, bleh.  Dad ordered chicharones de pollo, all bones, and tostones were not cooked right.  Didnt see our waitress til we asked for the check.  Usually we give constructive criticism, but just wanted to get going.

data.title: nice environment
data.text: If you like Latin music "MERENGUE" and Dominican food, this is your place to dine. Nice music and on week ends there is a band.  Dominican food, home made typical food. I ate churrasco and it was very good. Not much food, enough for me, I eat little. Little pricey but nice and big place. I guess the rent is high. I think they don't have to change the price, but should give more food. People here like big quantity of food.

data.title: Pricey for bar food
data.text: I went in at lunch time at it was completely empty. RED FLAG .... I tried the mofongo with pork chunks to go. over $12 dollars so I expected a hearty dish. When I got it, was disapointing to see pork chunks with a scoop of the mofongo and nothing else.....I recommend if you are going to charge that much for a meal...include rice or another side item. The bartender mentioned that they have lunch special but they had to no menu to show me what they are....he agreed with me that they should print up the daily lunch specials...would not repeat due to its pricey menu....

data.title: Drinks were good….
data.text: Stopped at juanas for drinks with my boyfriend……not bad compared to The Pub,Brios and the sushi place at the shops at pembroke gardens where the drinks are weak.  Will go back to try the food. Friday night….dj and a man singing salsa songs. Not bad. Hopefully will go back and they will impress me with their food. Will keep my fingers crossed. :))

data.title: Nice time with family
data.text: The family, sister; daughter and grandboy went to this restaurant on a Saturday night.  They had a live band playing salsa music which was great!  We had the Juana sampler which consists of different types of appetizers which was also great.  They have live music on some weekends which makes the dining experience even better.

data.title: Overall extremely dissapointed
data.text: I am very dissapointed with my entire dining experience at this establishment. I first went there 2 months ago for lunch and it was a good experience....food was good, service was good. Now the 2nd time I went there it was completely different. Everything that could go wrong DID. First, we had a waitress that only spoke Spanish. She did not know what a Jaagermeister shot was....even though they had the Jaager machine at the bar. I had to literally get out of my chair and show her. I digress. First we  were seated. I ordered the Mofongo with pork chunks which was great last time I was there. This time it was DRY...horribly dry and undercooked. I asked for a Margarita before ordering food. It took literally 15 minutes before the margarita arrived. Their excuse....there was no bartender. If that's the case, close the freaking bar. Ridiculous. I drank my Margarita after already eating half a portion of my Mofongo. I then asked for the Jaager shot. Again...a fiasco. I had to point out the machine to her and it took about 5-10 minutes before I received it. Keep in mind the restaurant was EMPTY...there were only 3 small groups of people at that time. We then asked for salsa sauce. The sauce had rotten tomatoes in it. The smell was unbearable and the taste was just like ROTTEN TOMATOES. My wife's sister never had her water glass refilled....none of us had our water refilled. The food came fast...that was the only good thing. Then Mrs.Juana decides to show up and check up on our table. We told her about the rotten salsa and she immediately confronted the waitress and went back in the kitchen. However, NO FOLLOW UP was made with us regarding this. No apology, no discount. Nothing. Terrible customer service. I asked the hostess if they recently changed cooks and she said yes....I had a hunch because the food was good 1st time I was there. Anyhow, the restaurant was overpriced for the quality of food we received. Between the 4 of us, we paid 91.00.   I of course should have left NO tip, but being the nice guy that I am, I left her a 5.00 tip. I will never visit this place again.

data.title: Superior food and service
data.text: Our family of four visited on a Sunday night. The goat stew and cuban sandwich were excellent. We sat at the bar, and our waitress was excellent, describing to us some of the more exotic dishes that we were not familiar with. One of the owners even stopped by to chat with us. Overall, an excellent evening.

data.title: Almuerzo Amigos
data.text: Para latinos - dominicanos y visitantes en Miami, acá tienen una opción de costo apropiada para tomar unas cervezas y comer comida criolla y típica de República Dominicana. Buenas atenciónes y sin duda regresaré en mi próxima visita.

data.title: Excellent place
data.text:
Es un lugar super limpio , Comida sabrosa y servicio excelente .....Lo recomiendo 100% , Los dueños muy atentos y sobre todo la comida super buena y salio super rrapido. Me encanto !! ........Love it!!!!!!!

Gracias
